meanings.definition: Relating to or consisting of an appendage or appendages.
meanings.sent1: The spider's appendicular legs helped it climb up the wall.
meanings.sent2: The doctor examined the patient's appendicular growth carefully.
meanings.sent3: The appendicular branches of the tree seemed to wave hello in the wind.
meanings.sent4: Her appendicular creativity knew no bounds when it came to crafting.
meanings.sent5: The appendicular decorations on the cake made it truly stand out at the party.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to the limbs or extremities of the body.
meanings.sent1: The athlete focused on strengthening his appendicular muscles for the race.
meanings.sent2: She felt a sharp pain in her appendicular arm after the fall.
meanings.sent3: The appendicular fingers on the puppet moved gracefully across the stage.
meanings.sent4: His appendicular reach was so long, he could touch the ceiling without standing.
meanings.sent5: The appendicular dance moves of the performer captivated the audience.
